abstract.p: Westchester County (NY) offers to include local police departments in electronic booking system that captures, transmits and stores arrest information, including fingerprints, palm prints and face shots (S)

block.p: The county is offering to include local police departments in an electronic booking system that captures, transmits and stores arrest information, including fingerprints, palm prints and face shots. Departments that choose to be connected will be able to use either ''live scan'' equipment, which records fingerprints and palm prints without ink, or ''card scan'' equipment, which digitizes fingerprint and palm print data, using a single set of inked impressions. A digital camera puts face shots directly into the system. The county's Department of Public Safety is covering the cost of the new network. Other departments are only responsible for buying booking and investigative work stations, which hook into the network, at a cost of $18,000 to $75,000. Departments may qualify for state and federal financing.
